briefTitle: Evaluating the Effectiveness of Intravenous Immunoglobulin Therapy in Autoimmune Autonomic Ganglionopathy
officialTitle: A Double-blind, Randomized, Placebo-controlled Trial to Evaluate the Efficacy of Intravenous Immunoglobulin Therapy in Autoimmune Autonomic Ganglionopathy.
summary: The purpose of the study is to see if administering intravenous immune globulin (IVIG) (putting immune globulin directly into your blood) helps to improve the symptoms of orthostatic hypotension (sudden fall in blood pressure when a person stands up) and quality of life in men and women who have autoimmune autonomic ganglionopathy (AAG).

primaryOutcome.measure: Change in Systolic Blood Pressure During 60° Tilt (ΔSBP)
